page.title: 01New Forest-Introduction
page.content: The predominant land cover for this area of the New Forest is woodland. This consists of mixed conifers and deciduous trees. Moorland begins to the south and north-east. This area is available for tourism and leisure. Car parks and a camp site exist at various locations providing a base from which to walk through the forest on the many pathways and gravel roads and observe the plant and animal life. Within this area is a small restricted zone for deer research. However it is possible to see deer throughout the area. The main London to Bournemouth railway line crosses this area and provides the opportunity for train spotting. Much evidence of Forestry can be seen in this woodland area including felling of trees and reafforestation.
